article_title: Mass. Congressional delegation divided on few issues in 2015
article_text:
By Peter Urban

GateHouse Media Washington Bureau

Posted Jan. 10, 2016 at 11:00 AM

Updated Jan 13, 2016 at 11:08 AM

article_metadata.description:
WASHINGTON – Through hundreds of roll call votes cast in 2015, the Massachusetts delegation in Congress stood largely together with their fellow Democrats – dividing on just a handful of issues.
In the House, which cast 705 roll calls, the nine members from Massachusetts split 5-4 on just eight votes that dealt with among other things cyber surveillance, medical equipment taxes, and the military. In the Senate, which cast 339 roll calls, Sens. Edward Markey and Elizabeth Warren
article_metadata.author: Peter Urban GateHouse Media Washington Bureau
